## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. It is a notebook interface to put together text and code in a result of a formatted output. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

#Narrative Section
After completing the format of the R Markdown document, you can knit the document that shows the content and output of the R code. 

#LaTeX Math Expression
Here is an example of a LaTeX math expression

$$ x= \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a} $$

#Load libraries
Load any libraries needed for your R code.

```{r}

library(ggplot2)

```

#Load dataset
Load your dataset for analysis.

```{r}

cars <- mtcars

```

#Generate a plot
Generate a plot using the dataset loaded in.

```{r}

scatter <- ggplot(cars, aes(x=mpg, y= wt)) + geom_point()

scatter

```
